Ethics

Apr 26, 2025

This is the ethics page.

From the IEEE(1999),

Software engineers shall commit themselves to making the analysis, specification, design, development, testing and maintenance of software a beneficial and respected profession. In accordance with their commitment to the health, safety and welfare of the public, software engineers shall adhere to the following Eight Principles:

first principle Act within the public interest
second principle Act with the best interest of clients & employers
Third principle Products meet highest standards
Fourth principle maintain integrity
Fifth principle promote ethical management
Sixth principle Advance the profession within the public's interest
Seventh principle Fair & supportive of colleaguesÂ 
Eight principle Participate in lifelong learning and promote ethical sollutions

For data science ethics, Maryville University (2025) offers similar guidelines:

  • Act with integrity, humility, and honesty
  • Hold themselves and others accountable
  • Promote transparency
  • Remain informed about developments in data science and data management
  • Respect confidentiality and privacy
  • Respect individuals, communities, and the public
  • Uphold applicable ethical standards, professional practices, statutes, and regulations

Refrences:
IEEE Computer Society. (1999). Code of Ethics. IEEE. https://www.computer.org/education/code-of-ethics
Maryville University. (2025). Data science ethics: Issues and strategies. https://online.maryville.edu/online-masters-degrees/data-science/careers/data-science-ethics-issues-and-strategies/
